intro: Caroxylon vermiculatum, commonly known as the wormwood plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. It has adapted to survive in dry environments with its deep root system and succulent leaves. Caroxylon vermiculatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
